text:
Probably already suggested — It would be nice to have a caption when inserting images.
It’s useful for galleries of photos or blog posts. Right now the marketing team hacks the text editor to do it and we get inconsistent results from a post to another.
You could build a custom module that offers that
or build the image into the template, and have a text field. that would force it to always be consistent - both are good options
you could probably use a class on the img and then use JS to get the alt text and display that as a caption below it.
or a data attribute on the img to do it as well
That not really an option when inserting images with a rich text field.

Was thinking of this option, but I would prefer not rely on JS for this kind of stuff. What’s an image without a title and a caption attached to it? Title and caption could be part of any elements in the Files manager.
Didn't realize it had to be within a rich text field. I figured it would replace that
